title: Riot... I legitimately hope I get an answer from one of you about Demolish: Why do you HATE towers?
body:
Seriously, WHY does a Rune like Demolish even exist when turrets are in the state they're in currently?

_**60 second CD:**_ Your next attack deals 375 + 20% of your Max HP to tower after being within 600 range of it for 4 seconds... um... w-where's the Ranged handicap? Riot you... you're going to do the 50% effectiveness for Ranged right? You're not gonna let it stay like this for months like all the other changes broken by Ranged champs and... oh no...

You're at least buffing Towers right? You must be... _**RIGHT?**_

https://media.giphy.com/media/cZHNk21INIlKo/giphy.gif

We've been doing some investigation into tower and minion tuning for pre-season, we're not sure if/what we're going to ship, but the demolish rune would definitely be tuned around whatever state turrets end up in. Anecdotally it feels like it's in a pretty decent spot right now. Pretty sure I've only ever seen it on tops and supports and not marksman in our playtests, though I'm certain it can be a viable strat that players opt into. The idea being that there's a lot more opportunity cost in the new runes than the old system means that a marksman should be giving up something substantial to go resolve over another secondary path.

TL;DR - we're looking at some stuff with turrets for pre-season, we might not ship anything, and I haven't seen a demolish abuse case yet internally.

Hope that helps!
How come you decided to make the range of Demolish long enough (600) for _most_ marksmen to be able to proc it even at their max attack range? Just curious!

I haven't actually been involved in the design decision making process for the runes so far, i've just been playtesting and giving feedback. My guess would be something like not wanting marksman to feel like they **couldn't** get Demolish, and instead just make sure the opportunity cost of taking it was high enough that you only took it in very specific circumstances when it meshed with your teams strategy. Just my hypothesis though.

It also allows most melees to not get dicked by being slightly shoved out of the range as easily. IF it was say, 300 units, it would be really hard to pull off and require a ton of investment.. This is pretty forgiving.

I would say maybe too forgiving but that's just me.
